active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the statement: 'The NIST Privacy Framework is sufficient on its own for global data protection compliance, or must it always be mapped to region-specific regulations like GDPR and CCPA?' Support your position with examples of risks and benefits, encouraging critical thinking on integration challenges.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Data Protection Compliance (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Governance Principles > Policy and Compliance Management > Compliance Management > Data Protection Compliance). Use the provided learning objectives (spanning Bloom's REMEMBER to CREATE), active learning components for context, 4-layer scaffolding (Foundation to Integration), and flashcard schema to generate 50 high-quality flashcards. Incorporate this complete content: [Insert full scaffolding descriptions here, plus research context: Core concepts (PII, PHI, etc.), NIST PF 1.1 details (Functions, Profiles, Tiers, AI/privacy), GDPR/CCPA/HIPAA/ISO 27001, best practices]. Sources: NIST PF 1.1 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/CSWP/NIST.CSWP.29.pdf), GDPR (eur-lex.europa.eu), CCPA (oag.ca.gov/privacy/ccpa), HIPAA (hhs.gov/hipaa), ISO 27001 (iso.org). Output ONLY in JSON array of objects, each: {"id":1, "bloom_level":"REMEMBER", "scaffolding_layer":1, "type":"Q&A", "front":"Question text", "back":{"answer":"Correct answer", "explanation":"Detailed explanation with rationale and references", "distractors":["A","B","C"] if MCQ}}. Ensure: Progressive difficulty, active recall, distractors per protocol, coverage of all objectives/layers/frameworks/AI considerations. No extraneous text.
